headline: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

content.title: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
content.summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

headline: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV and film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to ​the streaming pioneer that has upended the media industry.  The agreement - announced on Friday - follows a weeks-long bidding war where ‌Netflix seized the lead with a nearly $28-a-share offer that eclipsed Paramount Skydance's nearly $24 bid for the whole of Warner Bros Discovery, including the cable TV assets ‌slated for a spinoff.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry Potter" will further tilt the power balance in Hollywood in favor of the streaming giant that built its dominance without major acquisitions or a large content library, helping its efforts to ward off competition ⁠from Walt Disney and the Ellison family-backed Paramount.

content.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
content.summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV and film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to ​the streaming pioneer that has upended the media industry.  The agreement - announced on Friday - follows a weeks-long bidding war where ‌Netflix seized the lead with a nearly $28-a-share offer that eclipsed Paramount Skydance's nearly $24 bid for the whole of Warner Bros Discovery, including the cable TV assets ‌slated for a spinoff.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry Potter" will further tilt the power balance in Hollywood in favor of the streaming giant that built its dominance without major acquisitions or a large content library, helping its efforts to ward off competition ⁠from Walt Disney and the Ellison family-backed Paramount.

headline: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.  It had been reported that the US streaming giant was in exclusive talks over the deal following a bidding war for the assets.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors.

content.title: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
content.summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.  It had been reported that the US streaming giant was in exclusive talks over the deal following a bidding war for the assets.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors.

headline: Netflix in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery assets, source says
summary:
STORY: Netflix is reportedly in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery's film and television studios, along with its streaming assets.

According to a source with direct knowledge of the matter, it's after offering $28 per share.

The parent of HBO received a second round of bids this week.

Netflix, Paramount Skydance and Comcast had made preliminary buyout proposals.

Reuters previously reported that Netflix was seen as the top bidder, and made a mostly cash offer.

The $28 per share offer compares with Warner Bros' closing price of $24.54 on Thursday (December 4).

And a previous offer from Paramount of nearly $24 for all of the company's assets that also include cable networks like CNN, TNT and TBS.

Netflix and Warner Bros Discovery did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment.

Netflix is aggressively diversifying beyond its core subscription model.

A deal with Warner Bros would give it one of Hollywood's most powerful libraries, including "Harry Potter" and "Game of Thrones".

Variety reported the potential deal has led a group of leading film industry figures to urge the U.S. Congress to intervene if Netflix's bid succeeds.

They have apparently warned of a looming economic and institutional crisis in Hollywood.

Paramount has also reportedly accused Warner Bros of running an unfair sale process that favors Netflix over other bidders.

content.title: Netflix in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery assets, source says
content.summary:
STORY: Netflix is reportedly in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery's film and television studios, along with its streaming assets.

According to a source with direct knowledge of the matter, it's after offering $28 per share.

The parent of HBO received a second round of bids this week.

Netflix, Paramount Skydance and Comcast had made preliminary buyout proposals.

Reuters previously reported that Netflix was seen as the top bidder, and made a mostly cash offer.

The $28 per share offer compares with Warner Bros' closing price of $24.54 on Thursday (December 4).

And a previous offer from Paramount of nearly $24 for all of the company's assets that also include cable networks like CNN, TNT and TBS.

Netflix and Warner Bros Discovery did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment.

Netflix is aggressively diversifying beyond its core subscription model.

A deal with Warner Bros would give it one of Hollywood's most powerful libraries, including "Harry Potter" and "Game of Thrones".

Variety reported the potential deal has led a group of leading film industry figures to urge the U.S. Congress to intervene if Netflix's bid succeeds.

They have apparently warned of a looming economic and institutional crisis in Hollywood.

Paramount has also reportedly accused Warner Bros of running an unfair sale process that favors Netflix over other bidders.

headline: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. in a $72-billion deal that will transform Hollywood
summary: A theater owner trade group immediately blasted Netflix's $72-billion deal to buy Warner Bros. and HBO. Netflix has long bypassed movie theaters, instead releasing films onto its streaming platform.

content.summary: A theater owner trade group immediately blasted Netflix's $72-billion deal to buy Warner Bros. and HBO. Netflix has long bypassed movie theaters, instead releasing films onto its streaming platform.

headline: Paramount Made A Last-Minute, Final Bid For Warner Bros. It Got Rejected.
summary: Late Thursday evening, Paramount Skydance (PSKY) attempted a final, last ditch, all-cash bid to acquire the entirety of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $30 a share, according to the CNBC. Warner Bros. rejected that offer. Instead it accepted Netflix's slightly lower offer of $27.75 for only part of the company. Paramount shares tumbled on the news its final bid fell...

headline: How Investors Are Responding to the Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Today
summary: Netflix on Friday agreed to buy the movie studio and streaming service of competitor Warner Bros. Discovery. Netflix shares pared their losses Friday morning, while Warner Bros. traded nearly 10% below the acquiring price, reflecting some skepticism on Wall Street.
